title: Sans caps on "Motor Comptoir Zurich 1932" vintage poster by Otto Baumberger
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203144im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Baumberger,%20Otto_5713.jpg)

hi, i’m new here, and as a part-time retro design fetishist i’m looking for a font used by Otto Baumberger on the poster above.

If anyone has an idea which one it is, give me a shout, please!

thanks... Chriggy

 [‹ Suggestions for Cute Font.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203144/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50233 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Who designed the typeface "Popular"? - Christian Schwartz {Mike Solita (self)} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203144/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50318 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Chriggystardust

comments.content: This is almost certainly hand drawn, and it does look gorgeous indeed.
yeah, the word “motor” suddenly looks nice to me... any idea what substitute font i could use (i mean i do start draw myself right now, but unfortunately the result won’t be gorgeous)? Chriggy
Phew, I’d have to check. There are quite a few Art Deco inspired digital fonts available, but I don’t know off the top of my head of any that are this wide and blocky. :^/

I think the R is out of proportion and the G is too heavy. But it is fun. You might like [Anisette](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203144/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/Anisette) and [Anisette Petite](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203144/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/AnisettePetite).
you were right, i like Anisette as well...

hey Miss Tiffany, what other fonts similar to Anisette can you suggest? i’m still looking for such a font to buy, Anisette IS great, but maybe there’s one that i’d like even more?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203144im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Anisette_exemple_5459.gif)
How about [Mostra](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203144/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra/) which is very affordable?

[Bahnhof](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203144/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-10-bahnhof) by [František Štorm](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203144/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Franti%2525C5%2525A1ek%252B%2525C5%2525A0torm) is in the same genre – but probably not as versatile as Mostra.
You might also like [Recovery](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203144/http:/www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=NzQ5) at TypeTrust by James Puckett.
